segments.text: I see the sink faucet running wildly, water cascading over like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is gross, soaking everything in sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman steps right into it without a care, apron getting wet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes piled up, probably dirty from earlier meals.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy rummages in the cookie jar like a sneaky raccoon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His stool is filthy from the floor, and he's balancing precariously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl begs for cookies, crumbs will be everywhere soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water damage will make the cabinets moldy and smelly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen is turning into a swamp; it's revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the tidy garden outside can't hide the mess indoors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hate seeing food stolen like thatâ€”such poor manners.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Turn off the tap before it's a total disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything feels sticky and unclean now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The plate she's drying might slip into the flood.
segments.speaker: PAR
